TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HostSecurityPolicyResults extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of security policy to apply to an assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.HostSecurityPolicyResults> class is used to supply the return value for the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.HostSecurityPolicyResolver.ResolvePolicy%2A> method. Use this method if you want to customize ASP.NET run-time behavior to override the ASP.NET code access security policy. The enumeration value that is returned by the method indicates the type of security policy to use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Hosting.HostSecurityPolicyResults AppDomainTrust = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the permission set that is associated with the instance should be applied to the specified assembly. This means that the assembly should be treated as a user assembly that is loaded into the partial-trust ASP.NET instance. In addition, the assembly should have the permission set that was assigned to the instance at initialization.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Hosting.HostSecurityPolicyResults DefaultPolicy = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that ASP.NET should use default logic to determine the appropriate permissions set for the specified assembly. You should return the value if you do not you want to decide the permission set for the assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Hosting.HostSecurityPolicyResults FullTrust = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the specified assembly should be granted full trust.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Hosting.HostSecurityPolicyResults Nothing = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the permission set for the specified assembly is set to empty. An empty permission set is a new instance of the class, with a parameter value of passed to the constructor. An assembly that is associated with an empty permission set will not load in an ASP.NET partial trust application domain. Therefore, you can use the field to prevent an assembly from loading into a partial trust ASP.NET application domain.
